content.question: The California grunion (Leuresthes tenuis) is a small marine fish that lives in shallow waters near the ocean shore. Grunions swim as far onto the beach as possible to mate and lay their eggs (spawn). A researcher proposes that the spawning behavior takes place when the nighttime tides are highest during the month. Which of the following pieces of evidence would best support the researcherâ€™s claim?

choices.label: Grunion spawning occurs every two weeks during the spawning season.
Grunion spawning occurs when nighttime illumination levels are the lowest.
High tide occurs one time per lunar cycle.
The light intensity of the moon varies within the lunar cycle.

content.answer: Grunion spawning occurs every two weeks during the spawning season.

skill.text: 6.C: Provide reasoning to justify a claim by connecting evidence to biological theories.
